intro: Monnina acuminata, commonly known as the sharpleaf monnina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with four petals and a distinctive central stamen. Monnina acuminata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as plains and disturbed areas.
